meanings.definition: Capable of being billed for services rendered.
meanings.sent1: The completed project was billable, so the client will pay for it.
meanings.sent2: The company only charges for billable hours worked by employees.
meanings.sent3: The billable work was like a treasure waiting to be claimed by the client.
meanings.sent4: Her efficiency made her time seem billable, like gold in the hands of the company.
meanings.sent5: The concept of billable hours is crucial for tracking revenue accurately.

meanings.definition: Able to be charged or invoiced for.
meanings.sent1: The repair was billable, so the customer knew the cost upfront.
meanings.sent2: The extra services provided were all billable and added to the final invoice.
meanings.sent3: The billable amount was like a surprise gift in the bill.
meanings.sent4: Her expertise made her advice seem billable, like a valuable commodity.
meanings.sent5: Understanding what is billable ensures accurate billing for the company.

meanings.definition: Qualifying for payment by a customer.
meanings.sent1: The approved expenses were all billable and reimbursed by the client.
meanings.sent2: Only the billable items were included in the final receipt for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The billable services were like a ticket to financial compensation.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication made her efforts seem billable, like a valuable investment.
meanings.sent5: Tracking billable expenses is essential for financial transparency.
